message.content:
We “discover” that none of the opening (“Initial…”) transactions show any tax‐component and that almost all “Sale” transactions carry a “tax_amount” value. (No tax adjustment or pre‐existing liability is given.) Therefore, in our workbook the “initial” taxes payable balance is zero. In order to “close” the reporting period we must sum the tax amounts recorded on every sale. (In our example the “tax_amount” on a sale for a service (or product) is taken to represent the tax due on that sale and hence included in “taxes payable” in the balance sheet.) 

In our new transaction table the sale rows (identified by their id starting “Sale …”) have the following tax amounts:

 • Sale20240102001: 2,658.54  
 • Sale20240104004: 2,379.68  
 • Sale20240105005:  147.18  
 • Sale20240105006: 2,377.76  
 • Sale20240106009: 13,122.28  
 • Sale20240107010: 2,179.85  
 • Sale20240107011: 9,601.40  
 • Sale20240107012: 2,648.07  
 • Sale20240108015: 14,012.64  
 • Sale20240108016:  146.25  
 • Sale20240108017: 2,653.74

 • Sale20240109020:  527.28

 • Sale20240112024: 12,129.98

 • Sale20240112026: 12,179.53  
 • Sale20240114029: 2,245.54

 • Sale20240118041: 12,504.53  
 • Sale20240120043:  476.14  
 • Sale20240120044: 2,907.09  
 • Sale20240120045:  95.77  
 • Sale20240121047: 2,696.72  
 • Sale20240121048: 9,082.73  
 • Sale20240121049:  636.83  
 • Sale20240122050:  583.37  
 • Sale20240122051: 2,637.00  
 • Sale20240123053: 9,824.21  
 • Sale20240125056:  574.94  
 • Sale20240125057: 2,681.40  
 • Sale20240125058: 10,920.52  
 • Sale20240127060:  111.04  
 • Sale20240127061: 2,323.08  
 • Sale20240130063: 11,820.25  
 • Sale20240130064:  668.56  
 • Sale20240130065: 2,944.95  
 • Sale20240131068: 2,658.11  
 • Sale20240131069:  713.64  
 • Sale20240201071: 1,991.34  
 • Sale20240201072:  732.15  
 • Sale20240202073: 14,904.24  
 • Sale20240202074: 2,222.14  
 • Sale20240203075: 12,325.64  
 • Sale20240205076: 14,610.14  
 • Sale20240205077: 1,868.20  
 • Sale20240205078: 11,332.79

A careful step‐by‐step addition of these 52 “Sale” tax_amount figures yields a total of 243,988.48. (Because our transactions do not “net‐off” any collected or pre‐recorded tax, we interpret this sum to be the tax liability accumulated by the end of the period.) 

Thus we conclude that at period–end the “taxes payable” is 243,988.48 while the opening balance (which we assume to be zero) is 0.00.

The answer in the required JSON is therefore:

{
  "solution": {
      "Taxes Payable Initial Value": "0.00",
      "Taxes Payable End Value": "243988.48"
  }
}
